instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Hi there 

water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here. All S5 rails present. Thermal cam shows <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> has a tiny bit of heat. but i suppose it's expected 

I'm about to put it in the ultrasonic cleaner

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
First of all, try to start in SMC bypass mode.

Do you get a pulse at least on the 5V coil?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Does it charge the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
SMC bypass works woo!!!! No backlight though. So it's a sensor issue?

no pulse on l7520 which is what i think you meant

ppbus is 8.58

well i thought it didnt charge the battery but after the ultrasonic it does. also it's showing the batt symbol and fan spin without bypass when battery is plugged in. but without battery it does nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
So it doesn't start with charger only.
Then need to measure some points in <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area in this mode (no battery connected).

Pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 19, 20.
Post resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Post exact value (ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86; measured on board.
Did you try original Apple charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no fan spin
threads.message: so been testing this machine and it magically worked after ultra sonic. customer is happy. SOLVED
